param.name: invoice_date
param.description: Date of invoice.

param.name: amount
param.description: Amount to be taxed.

param.name: id_acc
param.description: Customer account id. This will be used to lookup the override taxband and tax eligibility country defined in the tax account view.

param.name: id_usage_interval
param.description: The usage interval associated with the transaction.

param.name: product_code
param.description: MetraTech product code

param.name: round_alg
param.description: Rounding algorithm. NONE for no rounding, BANK - for bankers rounding.

param.name: round_digits
param.description: 0 - no rounding, 1 round to 1 digit after decimal point, 2 for 2 digits, etc.

param.name: is_implied_tax
param.description: Y/N. Implied means taxes are included in the amount

param.name: is_std_implied_tax_alg
param.description: Y/N. Standard implied tax algorithm is tax=amount - amount/(1.0+rate). Alternate implied tax algorithm is tax=amount*rate.

param.name: id_tax_charge
param.description: Index for a tax transaction.

param.name: invoice_id
param.description: Used in the tax vendor's audit information. In the audit, the invoice_id may be reported with the corresponding tax details.

param.name: amount
param.description: Amount to be taxed

param.name: orig_pcode
param.description: Originating PCode

param.name: term_pcode
param.description: Termination PCode

param.name: svc_addr_pcode
param.description: Service Address PCode

param.name: customer_type
param.description: B/R/I/S B- Business, I-Industrina, R-Residental Customer, S- Senior Citizen

param.name: invoice_date
param.description: Date of the invoice

param.name: is_implied_tax
param.description: Y/N. Implied means taxes are included in the amount

param.name: round_alg
param.description: rounding algorithm. NONE for no rounding, BANK - for bankers rounding.

param.name: round_digits
param.description: 0 - no rounding, 1 round to 1 digit after decimal point

param.name: lines
param.description: When local service is provided, a transaction should be generated with the Lines field populated with the number of lines the customer subscribes to. EZTax uses this information for generation of per line taxes usually associated with local E911 charges and local telecommunications relay service taxes and other assorted taxes.

param.name: location
param.description: When local service is provided, the Locations Field should be populated with the number of locations the customer has. EZTax uses this information for generating local taxes that are mandated for location by the taxing jurisdiction. Most of these taxes are flat fees; however the charge field should be specified to allow for taxation based upon percentages of revenue instead of per location.

param.name: product_code
param.description: Product code to be mapped to Transaction Type, Service Type

param.name: client_resale
param.description: S-Sale, R-Resale

param.name: inc_code
param.description: Customer Inside or Outside incorporated area

param.name: id_acc
param.description: Customer account id. Will be used to define PK in BIllSoft generated log

param.name: id_usage_interval
param.description: The usage interval associated with the transaction.

param.name: is_regulated
param.description: Reseller regulated or unregulated in the state of sale. R-Regulated, U-Unregulated

param.name: telecom_type
param.description: C-Calls(telcom), D-Debit Card Calls, P-Point of sale

param.name: svc_class_ind
param.description: Long Distance or Local primary (D or L)

param.name: lifeline_flag
param.description: L- lifeline customer, I - not lifeline

param.name: facilities_flag
param.description: Facilities based flag (F or N)

param.name: franchise_flag
param.description: Franchise or Non-Franchise (F or N)

param.name: bus_class_ind
param.description: Business class indicator (C-CLEC or I-ILEC)

param.name: amount
param.description: Amount to be taxed.

param.name: id_acc
param.description: Customer account id. This will be used to lookup the override taxband and tax eligibility country defined in the tax account view.

param.name: id_usage_interval
param.description: The usage interval associated with the transaction.

param.name: product_code
param.description: MetraTech product code (unused by TWE)

param.name: round_alg
param.description: rounding algorith. NONE for no rounding, BANK - for bankers rounding.

param.name: round_digits
param.description: 0 - no rounding, 1 round to 1 digit after decimal point

param.name: invoice_date
param.description: Date of the invoice

param.name: is_implied_tax
param.description: Y/N. Implied means taxes are included in the amount

param.name: customer_name
param.description: On sales transactions the entity that purchases goods or services from the client. On purchases transactions the entity that sells goods or services to the client. If passed without "customer or vendor registration numbers, the customer or" vendor registration number may be derived from the UI setup. If passed with customer or vendor registration number, then the registration number will be used. If not passed, the customer- or vendor-specific tax rules will be ignored. example: The North West Company International Inc.

param.name: customer_code
param.description: See customer_name description. example: 11497

param.name: bill_to_address
param.description: The address to which a bill is sent. The location to which a bill is sent may help determine the Situs of a transaction. Locations may be identified by an address, a client code setup in the user interface, or by the unique GeoCode for an address. example: 550 West 64th Avenue

param.name: bill_to_city
param.description: See bill_to_address description. example: Anchorage

param.name: bill_to_state_province
param.description: See bill_to_address description. example: AK

param.name: bill_to_postal_code
param.description: See bill_to_address description. example: 99518

param.name: bill_to_country
param.description: See bill_to_address description. example: UNITED STATES

param.name: bill_to_location_code
param.description: See bill_to_address description.

param.name: bill_to_geo_code
param.description: See bill_to_address description. example: 1398242

param.name: loa_address
param.description: The client-defined name or code representing the client's location of order approval. The location at which an order is approved may help determine the Situs of a transaction.

param.name: loa_city
param.description: See loa_address description. example: Anchorage

param.name: loa_state_province
param.description: See loa_address description. example: AK

param.name: loa_postal_code
param.description: See loa_address description. example: 99518

param.name: loa_country
param.description: See loa_address description. example: UNITED STATES

param.name: loa_location_code
param.description: See loa_address description.

param.name: loa_geo_code
param.description: See loa_address description. example: 1398242

param.name: lor_address
param.description: The client-defined name or code representing the client's locations of order recording. The location at which an order is recorded may help determine the Situs of a transaction.

param.name: lor_city
param.description: See lor_address description. example: Anchorage

param.name: lor_state_province
param.description: See lor_address description. example: AK

param.name: lor_postal_code
param.description: See lor_address description. example: 99518

param.name: lor_country
param.description: See lor_address description. example: UNITED STATES

param.name: lor_location_code
param.description: See lor_address description.

param.name: lor_geo_code
param.description: See lor_address description. example: 1398242

param.name: lsp_address
param.description: The client-defined name or code representing the client's location of service performance. The location at which a service is performed may help determine the Situs of a transaction.

param.name: lsp_city
param.description: See lsp_address description. example: Anchorage

param.name: lsp_state_province
param.description: See lsp_address description. example: AK

param.name: lsp_postal_code
param.description: See lsp_address description. example: 99518

param.name: lsp_country
param.description: See lsp_address description. example: UNITED STATES

param.name: lsp_location_code
param.description: See lsp_address description.

param.name: lsp_geo_code
param.description: See lsp_address description. example: 1398242

param.name: lu_address
param.description: The client-defined name or code representing the client's location of use. The location at which a good or service is used may help determine the Situs of a transaction.

param.name: lu_city
param.description: See lu_address description. example: Anchorage

param.name: lu_state_province
param.description: See lu_address description. example: AK

param.name: lu_postal_code
param.description: See lu_address description. example: 99518

param.name: lu_country
param.description: See lu_address description. example: UNITED STATES

param.name: lu_location_code
param.description: See lu_address description.

param.name: lu_geo_code
param.description: See lu_address description. example: 1398242

param.name: ship_from_address
param.description: The client-defined name or code representing the client's ship-from location. The location from which goods are shipped may help determine the Situs of a transaction.

param.name: ship_from_city
param.description: See ship_from_address description. example: Anchorage

param.name: ship_from_state_province
param.description: See ship_from_address description. example: AK

param.name: ship_from_postal_code
param.description: See ship_from_address description. example: 99518

param.name: ship_from_country
param.description: See ship_from_address description. example: UNITED STATES

param.name: ship_from_location_code
param.description: See ship_from_address description.

param.name: ship_from_geo_code
param.description: See ship_from_address description. example: 1398242

param.name: ship_to_address
param.description: The client-defined name or code representing the client's ship-to location. The location into which goods are shipped may help determine the Situs of a transaction.

param.name: ship_to_city
param.description: See ship_to_address description. example: Anchorage

param.name: ship_to_state_province
param.description: See ship_to_address description. example: AK

param.name: ship_to_postal_code
param.description: See ship_to_address description. example: 99518

param.name: ship_to_country
param.description: See ship_to_address description. example: UNITED STATES

param.name: ship_to_location_code
param.description: See ship_to_address description. example: 31669

param.name: ship_to_geo_code
param.description: See ship_to_address description. example: 1398242

param.name: good_or_service_code
param.description: Unique identifier for a good/service code and its associated description used for reporting. The good or service can be uniquely identified by the source system's code that has been previously mapped to the Taxware code in the UI. example: 2038024

param.name: sku
param.description: Stands for ""Stock Keeping Unit"". A SKU is a number or string of alpha and numeric characters that uniquely identify a product." Not used by TWE. example: 604000003100

param.name: currency
param.description: Currency for all lines in the document. Pass through field to associate currency with a transaction. ISO-4217 Alpha-3 code is recommended however validation is not performed on this field. example: USD

param.name: organization_code
param.description: Organization that is asking TWE to perform tax calculation. example: MyCompanyName

param.name: origin_location_mode
param.description: (Default = G) The value in this field identifies the type of data in the OriginLocation field and tells CTQ how to access the data to find the origination jurisdiction. The values are: G = GeoCode, identifies the value in OriginLocation as a GeoCode, N = NPA/NXX, identifies the value in OriginLocation as an NPA/NXX, P = ZIP + 4 Code, identifies the value in OriginLocation as a ZIP + 4 Code.

param.name: origin_location
param.description: This attribute contains the Origin Location Information. This could be the geocode, npa/nxx or zip code.

param.name: termination_location_mode
param.description: (Default = G) The value in this field identifies the type of data in the TerminationLocation field and tells CTQ how to access the data to find the origination jurisdiction. The values are: G = GeoCode, identifies the value in TerminationLocation as a GeoCode, N = NPA/NXX, identifies the value in TerminationLocation as an NPA/NXX, P = ZIP + 4 Code, identifies the value in TerminationLocation as a ZIP + 4 Code.

param.name: termination_location
param.description: This attribute contains the TerminationLocation information of the service address location where the transaction (call) terminated.

param.name: invoice_date
param.description: This attribute contains the invoice date in the form CCYYMMDD. This date is used to determine whether the transaction took place before or after the effective date of the current rate. If it took place before the effective date on file, the previous rate is used. If the transaction took place on or after the effective date, the current rate is used.

param.name: amount
param.description: This is the dollar amount of the transaction being taxed. This amount is used as the base taxable amount for the calculation. If a particular tax requires that other amounts be added to the taxable amount, the calculation engine will do this automatically. The taxable amount will not be changed by calculation processing.

param.name: service_code
param.description: Describes the type of service within a service category.

param.name: category_code
param.description: This attribute describes the category of service being taxed (interstate, intrastate, wireless, and so forth).

param.name: product_code
param.description: Product code to be mapped to ServiceCode and CategoryCode

param.name: billed_lines
param.description: Number of billed lines.

param.name: trunk_lines
param.description: Number of trunk lines billed.

param.name: bundle_service_code
param.description: The service code associated with bundled service definition.

param.name: bundle_category_code
param.description: The category code associated with bundled service definition.

param.name: bundle_flag
param.description: Indicates if the transaction was for a bundled service.

param.name: call_minutes
param.description: The duration, in minutes, of the call being taxed, to the tenth of a minute.

param.name: chargeto_location
param.description: This attribute contains the GeoCode of the service address location where the transaction is billed or charged. NOTE:ChargeToLocationMode must be set to G before setting this attribute.

param.name: origin_incorporated_code
param.description: This attribute contains a code indicating whether the origin location lies within an incorporated area. If the tax authority from the rate record is 4 and this attribute is not set to O (outside), county tax is not calculated. You must know whether the customer is or is not located within the unincorporated area. If this attribute is populated with an O (the customer is located in the unincorporated area, the calculation will pick up the authority level 4 tax, if it exists. If an authority level 4 tax is present, no city level taxes (authority level 3) are returned. If the taxpayer is located within the incorporated area, the calculation picks up the authority level 3 taxes.

param.name: chargeto_incorporated_code
param.description: This attribute contains a code indicating whether the charge-to location lies within an incorporated area. If the tax authority from the rate record is 4 and this attribute is not set to O (outside), county tax is not calculated. You must know whether the customer is or is not located within the unincorporated area. If this attribute is populated with an O (the customer is located in the unincorporated area, the calculation will pick up the authority level 4 tax, if it exists. If an authority level 4 tax is present, no city level taxes (authority level 3) are returned. If the taxpayer is located within the incorporated area, the calculation picks up the authority level 3 taxes.

param.name: chargeto_location_mode
param.description: This attribute must be set before setting the attribute for the charge-to location (ChargeToGeoCode, ChargeToNpaNxx, or ChargeToPostalCode).Describes the type of data being passed as the ChargeTo location:G = GeoCode, N = NPA/NXX, P = Postal code

param.name: city_exempt_flag
param.description: Setting this attribute to X indicates that the current transaction is exempt from all city taxes. Default value: NULL

param.name: county_exempt_flag
param.description: Setting this attribute to X indicates that the current transaction is exempt from all county taxes. Default value: NULL

param.name: federal_exempt_flag
param.description: Setting this attribute to X indicates that the current transaction is exempt from all federal taxes. Default value: NULL

param.name: state_exempt_flag
param.description: Setting this attribute to X indicates that the current transaction is exempt from all state taxes. Default value: NULL

param.name: credit_code
param.description: A code used to indicate if the transaction is a credit. Possible values are Y (yes, this is a credit) and N (no, this is not a credit).

param.name: customer_code
param.description: A code used to designate the customer of a communications tax transaction. Some taxes apply to business or residential customers only, and this flag is used to determine whether a particular tax should be calculated. Valid Customer Codes are A(TAx on all customers), B (Tax on business customer only. This is the default), R (Tax on residential customers only), # (Deactivate Tax. Tax is not processed).

param.name: customer_reference
param.description: The invoice or customer reference number associated with the transaction. This may be used to pass transaction-specific information to be used for record identification or for display on reports.

param.name: saleresale_code
param.description: This attribute identifies the transaction being taxed as either a Sale (ResaleFlagSale) or a Resale (ResaleFlagResale). Valid codes are A (All sales), R (resale), S (sale), # (deactivate Tax. Tax is not processed).

param.name: transaction_code
param.description: The Transaction Code is used to distinguish normal tax calculation requests from special transaction processing. Example : default or adjustment.

param.name: taxed_geocode_incorp_code
param.description: If the DescriptionFlag attribute is set to Y for a tax calculation, then this attribute is valued with the IncorporatedCode of the taxing jurisdiction.

param.name: taxed_geocode
param.description: This attribute is returned after a tax calculation. It contains the GeoCode of the jurisdiction for which taxes were calculated.

param.name: taxed_geocode_override_code
param.description: A code used to explicitly specify the taxing jurisdiction. When set, this attribute overrides the standard behavior of the Two-of-three rule when determining a taxing jurisdiction. Note: With the exception of Vertex data for category 10 (wireless) transactions, depending on the rules of the taxing jurisdiction and regardless of which GeoCode Override Code you use, it may still be necessary to set one or both of the call location attributes (Origination, Termination, or Charge-to) that you are not using as the taxing jurisdiction. This is because the tax rules of the taxing jurisdiction may use either the origination or termination jurisdiction to determine whether tax applies. For example, the tax rules may include a requirement that the service in question originate in the taxing jurisdiction in order for the tax to be calculated. In this case, you would have to set an Origin attribute even if you were using the Charge-to location as the taxing jurisdiction. Valid Codes are A (override with origin), B (override with termination), C (override with charge-to), F (use origin location as taxedgeocode if rule finds no match), G (use termination location as taxedgeocode if rule finds no match), H (use charge-to location as taxedgeocode if rule finds no match), J (Evaluates the TaxedGeoCode and makes adjustments if a city was not identified in Two-of-three rule processing. The charge-to location is used to override the Two-of-three location if it matches the Two-of-three state or state/county. The origination location is used to override the Two-of-three location if the charge-to does not match the Two-of-three state or state/county combinations or if no Two-of-three match was identified at all.), Blank (Default. Two-of-Three processing rule applies).

param.name: user_area
param.description: This attribute can be used to pass transaction-specific information for record identification or for inclusion in reports. The User Area report is based on this information.Default value: 0

param.name: utility_code
param.description: A (Tax is on all service providers), R (Tax is on regulated service providers. This is the default value), U (Tax is on Unregulated service providers), # (Deactivate Tax. Tax is not processed.)

param.name: termination_incorporated_code
param.description: This attribute contains a code indicating whether the termination location is inside an incorporated region. If the tax authority from the rate record is 4 and this attribute is not set to O (outside), the county tax is not calculated. You must know whether the customer is or is not located within the unincorporated area. If the taxpayer is located in the unincorporated area and this attribute is populated with an O, the calculation will pick up the authority level 4 tax, if it exists. If an authority level 4 tax is present, no city level taxes (authority level 3) are returned. If the taxpayer is located within the incorporated area, the calculation picks up the authority level 3 taxes.Default value: I (inside the incorporated area)

param.name: origin_input
param.description: This is not documented by Vertex and will be NULLed. Used to hold Geocode_src - "LDRANI", "ACCOUNT", "OWNER"

param.name: termination_input
param.description: This is not documented by Vertex and will be NULLed. Used to hold Geocode_src - "LDRANI", "ACCOUNT", "OWNER"

param.name: charge_to_input
param.description: This is not documented by Vertex and will be NULLed. Used to hold Geocode_src - "LDRANI", "ACCOUNT", "OWNER"

param.name: id_acc
param.description: Customer account id. Will be used to define PK in BIllSoft generated log

param.name: id_usage_interval
param.description: The usage interval associated with the transaction.
